page.title: 03The Church in Holcot Village
page.content:
The churchyard is{neglected}since no-one wants to be resposible for its upkeep. The grass has not been cut this year, the gutters are blocked with dead leaves and the stonework is {decaying.
The interior of the church is better kept. Local ladies have a rota for cleaning and flower arranging.
The pews are polished and fresh flowers are arranged in vases but the carpets are becoming very{faded.}
The ancient{wall paintings}on the north wall are no longer recognisable. On the west wall a few heads are still visible as is a small pattern on the window splay at the west end.
